       SOUNDS LIKE VIOLENCE  With Blood On My Hands is a fitting           Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º
       title for SOUNDS LIKE VIOLENCE\&#039;s long-awaited full-length           Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º
       debut. There\&#039;s blood allright..and it\&#039;s coursing like venom         Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º
       through every song on the album. It\&#039;s smeared on the walls,         Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º
       dripping on the floor, oozing from frayed arteries and              Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º
       drowning lead vocalist Andreas SÃƒÂ¶derlund\&#039;s damaged, scarred         Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º
       psyche. It\&#039;s the blood that\&#039;s filling the hole where his            Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º
       heart used to be...and inciting the band\&#039;s frantic, downright       Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º
       explosive sound.                                                    Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º
                                                                           Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º
       If catharsis was the main theme of SLV\&#039;s critically-acclaimed       Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º
       debut CDEP The Pistol, then With Blood On My Hands takes it a       Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º
       step further by manifesting the unflinching, searingly-honest       Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º
       imagery of a man struggling with the demons of \"black love\"         Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º
       as SÃƒÂ¶derlund describes it. Whether it\&#039;s an affair that\&#039;s            Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º
       exciting-yet-destructive or simply the bitter condemnation of       Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º
       an ex-lover, With Blood On My Hands is a raw, exposed nerve         Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º
       revealing unhinged pain and jagged tension through its              Ãƒâ€ºÃƒâ€ºÃƒâ€º
